thread.title: U.S. Government Bonds Surge on Tepid Inflation

author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Surge on Tepid Inflation
text:
U.S. government bonds gained Thursday after a government report showed the pace of inflation is running slower than economists had forecast.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note fell to 2.971% from 3.004% Wednesday, the second-highest level for the year and snapping a four-day rise. Yields fall as bond prices gain.
